Potential Impact of the Solution

1. Environmental Sustainability

Reduced E-Waste: Diverts tons of electronics from landfills through easy access to local repair and recycling centers.

Lower Carbon Footprint: Refurbishing devices minimizes new production, reducing CO₂ emissions and resource use.

Circular Economy: Recovers valuable materials like copper, gold, and lithium for reuse in new products.

2. Social & Economic Empowerment

Job Creation: Connects repair experts, recyclers, and logistics providers to new income opportunities.

Skill Development: Builds digital and repair skills through community-led “fix-it” events.

Community Ownership: Gamified dashboards help neighborhoods track and celebrate their sustainability progress.

3. Technological Innovation

Smart Routing: AI/ML directs items to repair, recycle, or return pathways for optimal reuse.

Data Transparency: Impact dashboards show energy savings, CO₂ reduction, and materials recovered. Manufacturer Collaboration: Encourages producers to reclaim materials and design greener products.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Millions of homes hold unused or broken electronic devices — phones, laptops, routers, and other gadgets — that end up in landfills. This creates serious environmental hazards due to toxic materials and wasted valuable components. Most people don’t know where or how to recycle responsibly, and manufacturers rarely receive the returned materials for reuse.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

The ideal solution is a community-driven e-waste recycling platform built on ServiceNow, designed to make responsible disposal, repair, and manufacturer return simple and trackable. The goal is to transform e-waste management into an automated, transparent, and circular process.

ServiceNow Products & Capabilities Used

1. Service Catalog & Flow Designer

Users can submit requests to recycle or repair devices through a self-service catalog.

Flows and Subflows automate task assignments — e.g., pickup scheduling, technician dispatch, and manufacturer notifications.

2. IT Asset Management (ITAM)

Tracks each electronic item’s lifecycle from user to recycler or manufacturer.

Enables visibility into device ownership, warranty status, and material recovery.

3. IntegrationHub

Connects with external systems like logistics APIs (UPS/FedEx) for pickups and OEM systems for manufacturer returns.

Integrates sustainability and carbon-tracking tools for environmental impact insights.

4. Performance Analytics & Dashboards

Provides real-time analytics on e-waste collected, CO₂ saved, and materials reused.

Displays community leaderboards and progress toward sustainability goals.

5. AI Search & Predictive Intelligence

Classifies submitted items using AI models to route them for repair, recycling, or manufacturer return.

Recommends nearest verified centers or repair shops based on item type and location.

6. Employee Center / Citizen Portal

Offers a user-friendly portal for individuals, schools, and communities to participate in recycling programs.

Includes gamification and sustainability badges to encourage participation.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Technical Dependencies

Platform prerequisites (ServiceNow)

ServiceNow instance with: Service Catalog, Flow Designer/Subflows, IntegrationHub (Starter/Enterprise)

IT Asset Management (HAM Pro) for asset lifecycle, serialization, and disposition tracking

Performance Analytics for impact/KPI dashboards

AI Search / Predictive Intelligence (for item classification & routing)

Employee Center / Now Mobile (end-user portal & mobile scanning)

External integrations

Logistics APIs (UPS/FedEx/DHL) for pickup labels & tracking (REST/webhooks)

Manufacturer/OEM RMA systems (REST/SOAP) for return authorizations & take-back programs

Maps/Geocoding (e.g., Google Maps) for nearest drop-off & route ETA

Payments (Stripe/PayPal) if charging repair/handling fees

Email/SMS (SendGrid/Twilio) for status notifications

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Operational & Cost Challenges

Building partnerships with certified recyclers and logistics providers takes time and may add initial operational costs.

Funding and sustaining a reward-based or community incentive model could require sponsorship or grants.

Supply Chain Coordination

Ensuring traceability from pickup → repair/recycle → manufacturer return requires a strong chain-of-custody process and real-time updates from all stakeholders.
